pullRequest.title: SOLR-14700: avoid NPEs in TupleStream.getShards() when streamContext … …is null.

commit.message: SOLR-14700: avoid NPEs in TupleStream.getShards() when streamContext is null.

nodes.bodyText: There's a lot of complexity in this line, can we make it an if/else without wrapping and unwrapping an Optional? We are already doing a check on streamContext != null 6 lines up.
This is clever, add a comment that we're saving localCache because we need to close it later. :)
I really like how simple this test is.

commit.message: code review feedback: comment for localSolrClientCache

nodes.bodyText: It's possible for streamContext.getSolrClientCache() to return null and in that case combining the ternary and the conditional would give a different result. Would it help to have a comment re: that subtlety perhaps?

Good question. I just tried to fold the logic into the streamContext != null above but then the unit tests failed and (rightly so) identified that streamContext.getRequestReplicaListTransformerGenerator() can return null. We could still remove use of the Optional of course but it would require an additional if (requestReplicaListTransformerGenerator == null) block then. Thought?

commit.message: code review feedback: comment for null-ness subtlety, replace complex Optional use
